p:
Furthermore, studies using T. bellirica (Gaertn.) Roxb. fruit extracts to biosynthesize gold nanoparticles have been reported by Annavaram et al. (2017), who evaluated their antifungal potential. The authors showed that gold nanoparticles against Candida tropicalis and Candida albicans exhibited maximum zone of inhibition of around 16 and 14 mm, respectively. This effect was partially attributed to the presence of (3) gallic acid, (4) ellagic acid, (70) methyl gallate, (37) β-sitosterol, and (53) chebulagic acid.
Figure 4(v) , shows the chemical structure of some important compounds with antimicrobial properties.
